events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster due to keywords referencing a vehicle collision and accident.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case promptly to ensure further communication and investigation can begin without delay.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and sent an official confirmation email to the claimant within hours.
The insurance company requested additional documentation including photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report to process the claim further.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the police accident report, photos of the car damages, and a written statement describing the collision.
An investigation to assess the damages and liability was initiated, including contacting a vehicle inspection expert and verifying claim details.
The investigation concluded with a full report indicating the extent of damage to the customer's vehicle and confirming fault as per the accident details.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on the repair estimates and policy coverage after the investigation was completed.
The customer responded with dissatisfaction regarding the proposed settlement amount, requesting a higher compensation aligned with repair costs.
Due to customer concerns over the settlement, the claim was escalated to a senior claims manager for reassessment and further negotiation.
After review of the escalated claim, management approved an increased settlement amount that better reflected the vehicle damages reported.
The settlement payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s bank account as per the approved amount communicated earlier.
The claim was officially closed following issuance of payment and confirmation with the customer that the issue has been resolved satisfactorily.
